Class Time

java.lang.Object
  Time

public class Time
extends java.lang.Object

Contains methods to access the game time during levels and set its time to zero like a stop watch

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nick Meyer

Constructor Summary
Time()
           
 
Method Summary
static int getTime()
          If paused,
static void pause()
          Called to signify that the game is paused.
static void resume()
          Called to signify that a paused game has now been resumed.
static void setToTimeZero()
          Sets the time to zero
 
Methods inherited from class
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Time

public Time()
Method Detail

getTime

public static int getTime()
If paused,

Returns:
the time elapsed in milliseconds

pause

public static void pause()
Called to signify that the game is paused. If this is called, getTime() will not increase until resume() is called, when it will then increase normally

resume

public static void resume()
Called to signify that a paused game has now been resumed. Does nothing if the game has not been paused

setToTimeZero

public static void setToTimeZero()
Sets the time to zero
